alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:13PM EDT until April 05 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL CALHOUN...WEST CENTRAL CLARENDON...SOUTHWESTERN SUMTER AND SOUTHEASTERN RICHLAND COUNTIES... At 513 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Poinsett State Park, or 16 miles southeast of McEntire Air Base, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Weather spotters reported a funnel cloud at 500PM northeast of St. Matthews! IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Poinsett State Park around 520 PM EDT. Sumter and Millwood around 545 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Cane Savannah, Pinewood, Fort Motte, Paxville, Lakewood, Privateer and Wedgewood. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately.
